definition: to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Tom is an easygoing type of person who gets along well with everyone.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆是那種隨和的人，跟誰都合得來。
我和我的搭檔很合得來。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is hunky-dory, getting on nicely with almost everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他的女朋友挺不錯的，跟誰都合得來。

sentences.english: I think you two are gonna like each other.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得你們倆會合得來的。

sentences.english: We hit it off right from the start.
sentences.chinese: 我們從一開始就合得來。

sentences.english: Most of all, I am looking for someone who is compatible and share similar values.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是我們要合得來，有相似的價值觀。

sentences.english: I think we two really click。
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我們兩個蠻合得來的。

sentences.english: We've hit it off ever since we knew each other.
sentences.chinese: 我們從剛認識就很合得來。

sentences.english: I am compatible with my partner.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的搭檔很合得來。

sentences.english: Ex. Sue has so strong personality that few people can stand her.
sentences.chinese: 蘇的個性太強悍以至於很少有人能和她合得來。

sentences.english: Junko and I hit it off from the start.
sentences.chinese: 純子和我從一開始就合得來。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is hunky-dory, getting on nicely ost everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他的女朋友挺不錯的，跟誰都合得來。
